Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Complete patient intake form system with comprehensive libraries

Major additions:
- Patient intake form (7 sections, 5-10 min completion)
- Medical history library (132 diagnoses with smart expansion)
- Family history library (15 hereditary conditions)
- Surgical history library (40 procedures)
- Allergy library (31 allergies with safety alerts)

New files:
- PATIENT_INTAKE_FORM_MOCKUP.md: Complete visual demonstration
- PATIENT_INTAKE_FORM_PRODUCTION_SPEC.md: Full technical spec for dev team
- BD_TEAM_QUESTION_LIST.md: BD team training & role-playing guide
- CLINICAL_LOGIC_LIBRARY_DESIGN.md: Evidence-based rationale
- MEDICAL_HISTORY_TIER1_LIBRARY_v1.1_INTAKE_READY.md: Updated with intake integration
- FAMILY_HISTORY_TIER1_LIBRARY.md: 15 conditions with genetic risk stratification
- SURGICAL_HISTORY_TIER1_LIBRARY.md: 40 procedures with linked diagnoses
- ALLERGY_TIER1_LIBRARY.md: 31 allergies with EMR alert rules

Features:
- Smart expansion (1-4 follow-up questions per condition)
- Skip logic (mutual exclusion for "none" answers)
- Photo upload for medications
- Pre-population for returning patients
- Progress indicator & save/resume
- Complete database schema & API specifications
- Score modifier mapping for dashboard integration

Updated:
- Lifestyle questionnaires v2.1 optimized (frequency tier adjustments)
- Vietnamese translation complete
- SMART system library structure

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add cross-project integration architecture and master roadmap

New integration framework documents:
- 00_START_HERE.md: Quick navigation guide for all roles
- INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE.md: Complete integration specification
- CROSS_PROJECT_UPDATE_CHECKLIST.md: Maintenance procedures
- MASTER_ROADMAP.md: Unified development roadmap

Four-Section Workflow Model:
1. DATA INPUT MANAGEMENT: Patient data collection & processing
2. HEALTH OVERVIEW DASHBOARD: Live, continuously-updating visualization
3. SMART CARD/DECK SYSTEM: Patient self-directed care plans
4. PERFORMANCE MEDICINE PHILOSOPHY: Clinical framework & standards

Key Features:
- Section-based workflow rules and governance
- Cross-section data flow specifications
- SMART Card lifecycle (creation â†’ management â†’ de-loading)
- Live dashboard principle (continuous updates)
- Update protocol for maintaining consistency
- Project mapping (sections to file locations)

Integration Workflows:
- Patient onboarding â†’ Dashboard â†’ Card recommendations
- Diagnosis â†’ Score modifiers â†’ Card triggers
- Lifestyle scores â†’ Behavioral cards â†’ Adherence â†’ Dashboard updates
- Quarterly follow-up and refinement cycles

Patient Incentive Model:
More frequent data updates â†’ More accurate dashboard â†’ Better health insights

Phase 1 Foundation: 100% Complete
Phase 2 Next: Content creation + database implementation

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Consolidate integration architecture + add multi-agent AI system

CONSOLIDATION (Option B):
- Integrated UPDATE_CHECKLIST into INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE.md (Appendix A)
- Integrated VERSION_CONTROL protocol into INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE.md (Appendix B)
- Removed standalone redundant files
- Result: 3 core master files instead of 6

INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE v2.0:
- Now includes cross-project update checklist as quick reference
- Added version control workflow (6-step process)
- Critical dependency chains documented
- Reduced file proliferation while maintaining all content

NEW: MULTI-AGENT AI SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE (Section 3):
- 5 specialized AI agents working collaboratively:
  1. Dr. ADAPT - Clinical decision agent (prescription/de-prescribing)
  2. PharmaSafe - Medication safety agent (interactions/contraindications)
  3. CoachAI - Behavioral & adherence agent (lifestyle cards)
  4. DataWatch - Monitoring & alert agent (24/7 dashboard surveillance)
  5. PatientPal - Patient interface & triage agent

KEY IMPROVEMENTS:
- 97% autonomous decisions (up from 80% in 3-tier model)
- 4-tier progressive automation (Tier 1: 90% fully autonomous)
- Patient-first decision architecture (patients initiate 95% of actions)
- Minimal clinician burden (15-30 min per 100 patients)
- All 12 card types covered (corrected from 9)

DE-PRESCRIBING PATHWAYS (Detailed):
1. GRADUATION - Success pathway (goal achieved, celebrated)
2. TRANSITION - Adjustment pathway (too easy/hard/different method needed)
3. DISCONTINUATION - Stop pathway (no longer needed/effective)

TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION:
- Multi-agent orchestration using LangChain/CrewAI
- LLM foundation (GPT-4/Claude) + specialized knowledge bases
- 5-layer safety net (hard rules, confidence thresholds, multi-agent validation)
- Phased roadmap (Months 1-18 to full deployment)

FILE GOVERNANCE:
- Consolidation-first philosophy prevents file bloat
- Every file must pass 3-question test (uniqueness, longevity, necessity)
- Result: Cleaner, more maintainable project structure

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
CRITICAL FIX: Move multi-agent to platform-wide + add source verification

ISSUE 1 RESOLVED: Multi-Agent System Scope
- Moved from "CMO - SMART SYSTEM/" to master level
- Renamed: MULTI_AGENT_AI_SYSTEM â†’ MULTI_AGENT_AI_PLATFORM_ARCHITECTURE
- Clarified: 5 agents work across ALL 4 SECTIONS, not just Section 3
- Dr. ADAPT uses Section 1 (data) + Section 2 (dashboard) + Section 3 (cards)
- DataWatch monitors Section 2 continuously
- PharmaSafe validates Section 1 AND Section 3
- CoachAI uses Section 1 lifestyle data for Section 3 behavioral cards
- PatientPal interfaces across all sections

ISSUE 2 RESOLVED: Information Loss Prevention
- NEW: SOURCE_DOCUMENT_REGISTRY.md
- Lists canonical source for every critical specification
- 12 Card Types source: CARD_TYPE_SPECIFICATIONS.md (was missed!)
- Verification protocol: Read source BEFORE writing about topic
- Prevents working from incomplete memory (like listing 9 types instead of 12)
- 4-step process: Identify source â†’ Read source â†’ Cite source â†’ Validate

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
- Worked from memory instead of reading CARD_TYPE_SPECIFICATIONS.md
- Listed 9 types, missed 3 (Imaging Studies, DME, Environmental & Social Health)
- No systematic check forced source document verification

THE SOLUTION:
- Canonical Source Registry: ONE source of truth per topic
- Verification Protocol: ALWAYS read source first
- Citation Requirement: CITE and LINK to sources
- Audit Checklist: Cross-check completeness

INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE v2.1:
- Updated Related Documents section
- Added SOURCE_DOCUMENT_REGISTRY link (âš ï¸ Read FIRST)
- Added CARD_TYPE_SPECIFICATIONS link (âš ï¸ SOURCE OF TRUTH)
- Added MULTI_AGENT_AI_PLATFORM link (corrected scope)

FILE STRUCTURE NOW:
Master Level (5 files):
- 00_START_HERE.md
- INTEGRATION_ARCHITECTURE.md
- MASTER_ROADMAP.md
- MULTI_AGENT_AI_PLATFORM_ARCHITECTURE.md (moved from SMART SYSTEM)
- SOURCE_DOCUMENT_REGISTRY.md (NEW - prevents info loss)

These fixes address critical workflow issues that could cause
incomplete specifications and missed requirements.

EOF
